intro: Erica grisea, commonly known as the silver heath, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries. This evergreen shrub is characterized by its dense, compact growth and small, needle-like leaves that are covered in a fine, silvery-gray wax. Erica grisea produces clusters of tiny, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white, pink, and purple, typically blooming in spring. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
